page.title: 15ST.PETER'S CHURCH GOYTRE
page.content: The church belongs to the Church of Wales.Its map reference is {328/059,}just north-east of Wern Wood. It is in a beautiful setting and has a large graveyard.From a stone on the wall of the nave it is learnt that the church was rebuilt in{1845-6. Originally, the first rector began work in{1539,}he was called Hugh Johns. Until about{1860}services were conducted in Welsh then, by degrees, these were discontinued.Rev.H.J.T. Richards,(Rector from 1969-82),told us that a new vestry was built in 1982. The Rectory is an impressive house, built in 1891, about 100 yards from the churchyard.He told us of changes that had taken place in church services,such as Holy Eucharist, (Communion) in recent years.He told us he enjoyed all his church work in particular the chance to meet people.
